item.title: Live updates: U.K. election exit poll projects big win for Labour, end to 14 years of Conservative rule
item.dc:creator: William Booth, Karla Adam, Leo Sands, Kelsey Baker
item.description: Rishi Sunak and his center-right Conservative Party may be on the way out, replaced by Keir Starmer and the left-leaning Labour Party.

item.title: The intriguing real-life story of Keir Starmer, U.K.'s next prime minister
item.dc:creator: William Booth, Karla Adam
item.description: As the next leader of Britain, Keir Starmer brings working-class roots, a forensic legal style and a ruthless approach to politics.

item.title: Man sentenced to prison for carrying 6-inch replica Zelda sword
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman
item.description: The man argued the replica Master Sword from the Legend of Zelda games was being used as a “fidget” toy to keep his hands busy, but police said that was no excuse.

item.title: Can the king vote, and does he have a role in elections?
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan
item.description: The monarch and royal family members abstain from voting to stay above party politics, but there is no law preventing them, just convention.

item.title: Biden faces a high-stakes summit with his presidency in the spotlight
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung, Michael Birnbaum, Missy Ryan
item.description: Dozens of foreign leaders will descend on Washington next week for a show of NATO unity and celebration. But Biden’s faltering performance has them preparing for Trump.

item.title: Hurricane Beryl leaves storm-tossed Jamaica, heads for Cayman Islands
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cappucci, Justine McDaniel, Amanda Coletta, Scott Dance, Anumita Kaur, Kelly Kasulis Cho
item.description: The storm has been downgraded to Category 3 but is still expected to be “at or near major hurricane intensity” as it passes the Cayman Islands.

item.title: The five Conservative prime ministers of the past 14 years
item.dc:creator: Victoria Bisset

item.title: Stolen 16th-century painting, found at a bus stop, sells for record $22M
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih
item.description: “The Rest on the Flight into Egypt,” by the Venetian artist Titian, was stolen from its owner’s home in 1995 and recovered seven years later by an art detective.

item.title: Why is the U.K. poised to shift left when so many others are shifting right?
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam

item.title: It’s Election Day. Get ready for photos of dogs at polling stations.
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands

item.title: How the U.K.’s ‘first past the post’ system works
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor

item.title: What to know about U.K. election: Conservative collapse, Labour revival
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam, William Booth
item.description: When the election results are in, Britain’s center-left Labour Party, led by Keir Starmer, is expected to sweep into power, ending 14 years of Conservative rule.

item.title: It’s U.K. election day: A trash can is running, and dogs are everywhere
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands
item.description: What do pouring the perfect pint, posing next to a man wearing a trash can, and sharing a photo of your dog have in common? In the U.K., it means it’s election season.

item.title: Gaza hospital ‘completely empty’ after Israeli order in Khan Younis
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Hazem Balousha, Anika Seth
item.description: U.S. government officials who resigned over the Biden administration’s handling of the war in Gaza described it as “a failure and a threat to U.S. national security.”

item.title: Iran is picking a new president. Here’s what to know.
item.dc:creator: Anika Seth
item.description: A reformist and a conservative will face off in the second round of voting.

item.title: 51,000-year-old cave painting may be earliest scene depicted through art
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall
item.description: The artwork, an example of early storytelling, shows three humanoid figures and a pig. Sulawesi residents of that era were “besotted” with painting pigs, an expert said.

item.title: You didn’t ask for it, but Cup Noodles now has s’more-flavored ramen
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan
item.description: The new “campfire s’mores” dish mixes instant noodles with chocolate, graham crackers and marshmallow flavors. Reactions online ranged from intrigue to horror.

item.title: Jewish voters who abandoned U.K.’s Labour over antisemitism are returning
item.dc:creator: William Booth
item.description: Among those willing to give the Labour Party a second chance are voters who paid particular attention to how the party addressed antisemitism within its ranks.

item.title: A fungus is killing frogs. Homemade saunas might save them, scientists say.
item.dc:creator: Kyle Melnick
item.description: Australian researchers found that frogs fought off the chytridiomycosis disease in small sauna-like shelters that retained heat.

item.title: Kyiv’s shrouded and absent statues tell a story of war and defiance
item.dc:creator: Ed Ram, Kostiantyn Khudov
item.description: In Ukraine’s capital, statues are covered, protected and sometimes simply removed as a nation in the midst of war grapples with its history and identity.

item.title: A sculpture showed Mary giving birth to Jesus. A vandal beheaded it.
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Ables
item.description: The sculpture was destroyed just days after it went on view at a cathedral in Austria and drew criticism from some Catholics, who condemned it as sacrilegious.

item.title: The rich one, the ‘boring’ one and Trump’s buddy: Key U.K. election players
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman
item.description: Keir Starmer’s Labour appears poised to oust Rishi Sunak’s Conservatives from 14 years in power in the U.K. general election, with smaller parties also jostling for influence.

item.title: How 14 years of Conservative government have changed Britain
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor, William Booth, Artur Galocha, Samuel Granados
item.description: Having presided through austerity, Brexit and the pandemic, among other challenges, the Tories are deeply unpopular heading into the general election on Thursday.

item.title: Britain’s Conservatives face an ‘extinction-level’ event
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: An imminent Labour majority will arrive in the wake of a Tory calamity: widening inequality, slumping productivity and an entrenched cost-of-living crisis.

item.title: Severe turbulence injures over 30, diverts Air Europa flight to Brazil
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih
item.description: Passengers described the incident to local media as “terrifying” and like a “horror movie.” Videos on social media showed damaged seats and overhead compartments.

item.title: U.S. will fund deportations from Panama, expanding migrant crackdown
item.dc:creator: Nick Miroff
item.description: The Biden administration will begin paying for Panama to detain and deport more of the migrants streaming through Central America en route to the United States.

item.title: Hurricane Beryl is churning west after hitting Caribbean islands. Where it’s headed next.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cappucci, Amanda Coletta
item.description: Prime Minister Dickon Mitchell of Grenada said at least three people were killed and the possibility that the toll could rise was a “grim reality.”

item.title: Why Beryl is an early sign of a particularly dangerous hurricane season
item.dc:creator: Scott Dance
item.description: Not all storms will become behemoths like Beryl. But the hurricane has underscored the ways the stage is set for other storms to undergo similarly explosive development
